answerText: "Mid-Term Break"[10] "Mid-Term Break" can be found in the poetry collection Death of a Naturalist by this contemporary Irish poet who translated Beowulf in 1999.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Illinois A + Dorman A + Wellesley | 2 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: It begins "I sat all morning in the college sick bay" and proceeds to describe the reaction of the poet's family to the death of Christopher, the younger brother of the speaker. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this poem that ends "A four foot box, a foot for every year."
